Dear Ms. Vasilovski:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and
your contract.

ALLEGATION: Agency did not complete home visits to conduct adoption evaluation
INVESTIGATION:
I spoke with DCWL manager on 08/06/2020. She reports having contact with
Adoptive Parent 1 and notes the agency denied him for adoption without
interviewing him.
I reviewed Adoption Manager email dated 08/07/2020. It states Resident A was
placed with Adoptive Parent 1 on 08/15/2017 and consequently removed from the
placement by MDHHS on 02/09/2018. Home visits occurred on 10/18/17, 10/25/17
and 01/17/18. Case was pending as agency awaited MDHHS to complete its
special evaluation. The agency sent Adoptive Parent 1 a letter dated 08/16/2019
requesting additional documentation with a 14-day response time, which Adoptive
Parent 1 did not respond. The agency proceeded with the DHHS 612 as a denial on
10/10/2019.
I reviewed Adoptive Parent 1’s MDHHS adoption application. It was signed by
Adoptive Parent 1 on 10/12/2017.
I reviewed Adoptive Parent 1’s MDHHS adoptive family assessment addendum. It
was signed on 10/10/2019. The agency did not recommend the adoption of Foster
Child by Adoptive Parent 1.
2

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation.
(2) The report shall include the dates and places of contacts and
persons interviewed or observed.
ANALYSIS: There is no evidence to indicate the agency did not complete
home visits with Adoptive Parent 1. The agency visited his
home on 10/18/17, 10/25/17 and 01/17/18.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation.
(1) The initial written evaluation of the adoptive family must
be completed within 90 days of the family signing the
application and prior to making a recommendation to
approve the family for adoption.
ANALYSIS: The agency did not complete the Adoptive Parent 1’s evaluation
within 90 days of him signing the application. The application
was signed on 10/12/2017, whereas the MDHHS adoptive
family assessment addendum was not completed until
10/10/2019. It is noted that the agency was waiting for
completion of a MDHHS special evaluation.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
